_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Ice Cream and Frozen Dessert Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Release prevention. 

All receivers, compressors and exterior pipes have been located in safe locations away from possible contact with forklifts, trucks or other vehicles. The entire complex is surrounded by chain link fence for security.  The ammonia system is designed with high pressure and low pressure cutouts thoughout. Relief valves and backups are located on each pipe and vessel whIch has more than 10# ammonia capcity.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       The ammonia system has been designed to alarm, turn on ventilation and auto dial Emergency Responders when  50 PPM ammonia is detected and and  to shut off liquid solenoids upon detection of ammonia > 1,000 PPM.  Ammonia detectors have been installed in five locations throughout the facility where ammonia systems are located, including ice cream processing areas,  the compressor room and freezer warehouse. Emergency Solenoids will cut off the flow of liquid and the compressors will continue to run so the pipes are evacuated.  Emergency E-stops to shut down compressors are located in two areas outside of the compressor room. 

All drains in the facility have secondary containment that goes to holding tank for treatment should liquid ammonia go down the drain. 

Emergency Response 

The facility has five Level A suits and four Hazwoper 'Technician Level'  trained ammonia response personnel.   Additional equipment include two spare masks and four spare tanks.                                                                                                                                                              Responders are trained to respond in Level C suits and full face respirators when ammonia concentratioins are below

300 PPM. Reponsders are trained to respond in Level B suits when ammonia concentrations are between 300 and 1,000 PPM .   Responders are trained to respond to ammonia releases in level A suits when concentration is > 1,000. Responders will not respond to releases where ammonia levels are >16,000 PPM.  Testing of ammonia levels will be accomplished with MSA quick draw tubes. 
The Local Fire Department has been trained in the location of manual emergency cutoffs.  They are also capable of water deluging any ammonia vapor cloud that is visible.  Fire department may respond to in 'Turn Out' suits(Level B) to levels of ammonai <1,000 PPM.                                                                                                 The State Police through the Local Emergency Planning will provide Site Security and help evacuate community personnel as necessary.
In the event that the response effort takes longer than 2 hours, outside agreements have been signed with  Emergency Response Contractors.  (SER in Fort Wayne at 219-471-1168. )
